text: Clarence Matthew Baker (December 10, 1921 â€“ August 11, 1959)Matt Baker at the Lambiek Comiclopedia was an American comic book artist. He is best known for drawing the costumed crime fighter Phantom Lady. Baker was active as early as the 1930s and 1940s Golden Age of comic books. He also penciled an early form of graphic novel, St. John Publications' digest-sized "picture novel" It Rhymes with Lust (1950). His specialty was good girl art, a comics and cartooning subgenre.Great Black Heroes - Matt Baker Baker was inducted into the Will Eisner Comic Book Hall of Fame in 2009. ==References== Category:American comics artists Category:1921 births Category:1959 deaths
title: Matt Baker
